column4: Hello, I will have a load of thin clients, that make their connections using the ICA protocol.  What do I need to configure in Ubuntu to accept these connections?
connections to what ?
The thin-clients will connect to virtualised Xubuntu desktops running in VMware
The thin-clients will use either ICA or RDP protocols, but ICA is better apparently
I missunderstood what you where asking, you'll just need firewall ports
IS that it, it will accept these connections by default?
well no, you'll have to enable desktop sharing, authentication etc etc etc
Ah, that's where I need pointing in the right direction - is there an article somehwere, as you seem to know what I might need to do?
I don't know of an actual article, however I suspect that https://help.ubuntu.com will have some docs
Ok, thank you :)
catch the link of pici, maynot be exactly what you want but very close
I think the remote desktop will only allow 3 connections at once
you may be better using something like ltsp
It might even be easier to use RDP - I'll try them both - thank you :)
rdp will still only allow 3 connections I think
as thats still the desktop sharing service on the desktop
I only want one connection - it's just to link a thin-client to it's virtualised machine
ahh earlier you said it was many
Each virtualised thin-client will onyl ever receive one connection
Oops....
Each virtualised Linux machine will only receive one connection from a thin-client
so each machine will only ever get one connection, full stop
Yup :)
